text.tspan: The proxemic web: designing for proxemic interactions with responsive web design
What if your dekstop would behave like a smartphone depending on your spacial orientation and distance to it?
This paper flips the concept of responsive web design over its heel and describes a prototypical system where an
ordinary desktop enhanced with physical space awareness, begins to exhibit 'reverse responsive' capabilities.
The proxemic web: designing for proxemic interactions with responsive web design
What if your dekstop would behave like a smartphone depending
on your spacial orientation and distance to it?
This paper flips the concept of responsive web design over its heel and
describes a prototypical system where an ordinary desktop enhanced
with physical space awareness, begins to exhibit 'reverse responsive'
The proxemic web: designing for proxemic interactions with responsive web design

flowRoot.flowPara: What if your dekstop would behave like a smartphone depending on your spacial orientation and distance to it?

This paper flips the concept of responsive web design over its heel and describes a prototypical system where an ordinary desktop enhanced with physical space awareness, begins to exhibit 'reverse responsive' capabilities.

text.tspan: The proxemic web: designing for proxemic interactions with responsive web design

flowRoot.flowPara: What if your dekstop would behave like a smartphone depending on your spacial orientation and distance to it?

This paper flips the concept of responsive web design over its heel and describes a prototypical system where an ordinary desktop enhanced with physical space awareness, begins to exhibit 'reverse responsive' capabilities.

text.tspan: Proceedings of the 2014 ACM International Joint Conference
on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing: Adjunct Publication
The proxemic web: designing for proxemic interactions with responsive web design

flowRoot.flowPara: What if your dekstop would behave like a smartphone depending on your spacial orientation and distance to it?

This paper flips the concept of responsive web design over its heel and describes a prototypical system where an ordinary desktop enhanced with physical space awareness, begins to exhibit 'reverse responsive' capabilities.

text.tspan: Proceedings of the 2014 ACM International Joint Conference
on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing: Adjunct Publication
This paper was a precursor to popular apps like 'HipChat'
